page.title: 16THE ANCHOR INN
page.content: ONE OF THE FEW FACILITIES IN WHITTONSTALL IS THE {PUBLIC HOUSE} KNOWN LOCALLY AS "THE ANCHOR".THE INN HAS BEEN THERE FOR ABOUT 200YEARS AND DERIVES ITS NAME FROM THE ANCHORAGE POINT FOR HORSES AND CARTS ON THE LONG CLIMB UP THE HILL TO WHITTONSTALL WITH COAL AND IRON ORE FROM MINES IN THE LOCALITY. TODAY THE ANCHOR IS THE POPULAR MEETING PLACE FOR YOUNGSTERS AT ITS WEEKLY DISCO DANCE AND IS ALSO THE HOME OF THE LEEK CLUB.THIS CLUB IS FOR REGULAR PATRONS OF THE ANCHOR WHO GROW LEEKS AND HOLD AN ANNUAL SHOW TO SEE WHO CAN GROW THE BIGGEST LEEK.EACH MEMBER WINS A PRIZE ACCORDING TO THE SIZE OF HIS LEEKS,THE TOP PRIZES ARE IN THE REGION OF Â£60. BEER COSTS 72p PER PINT GIN AND TONIC COSTS Â£1.
